reviews.text: This was a superb find - great location, superb food and excellent service. Andy, the proprietor is very jolly and an excellent host. Staff are friendly and nothing is too much trouble for any of them. Breakfast was perfect - cooked if you want it or cereals and fruit if you don't with a waiter who remembers your order from the previous day - impressive! Dinner was equally good and again great service. My only constructive comment would be regarding the heating in the rooms - despite turning the radiators off, they are still too hot due to the heated towel rails in the bathrooms. So hot - but many people may prefer it this way. Rooms are very individual, with sloping floors etc. All in all, I would highly recommend this place and hope to return.
reviews.title: Nothing too much trouble

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff very friendly and helpful. Very old building so clearly a compromise at times between the framework of the building and modern standards. I particularly liked the way the floors slope in a number of directions even within a single room.
reviews.title: Old building, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good bar with plenty of locals and a wide age range. Very good beers. Steak and ale pie big enough for two people so possibly best to skip the starter if you go for the pie.
reviews.title: centrally located, good value sweet little place

reviews.text: We stayed here one night for a weekend get away trip. The pros are: we really liked the way our room with slight uneven floor, low ceiling but with the black beams on top gives the room a very good character. Room got very good heating (I don't like being cold!), and breakfast was simple but nicely cooked. Being above a pub our room (No.2) was quite small but if you are only staying for one night there is not a real worry! Some parking in front of the hotel but also a free parking three minutes walk away.
reviews.title: Superb old style Market town Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Midweek stay our room was well laid out and very clean with all mod cons to a high standard the staff were excellent and very knowledgable of the town and its history there was a beautiful log fire in the bar and lovely pint of local ale well done
reviews.title: Historic comfortable welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped 2 nights in Room 2. Had lovely welcome from Andy who was always smiling and took the trouble to ask us if we'd had a good day, what we'd got planned etc. and seemed genuinely interested. Room was well furnished and bed very comfy. Nice also to have electric heater so we could control the heating ourselves (perfect if like me you feel the cold!). View from window was just overlooking a flat roof and buildings but on the plus side this meant that we weren't overlooking the road and it was therefore quiet on a night. Towels changed each day which you don't seem to get very often these days. Good hospitality tray. Ate in the restaurant both nights and food was excellent (as it was at breakfast). Lovely oak carved dining room. Reasonable prices and a very high standard of food/presentation, even when they were busy the food was served promptly. Bar can get very busy on a Friday/Saturday night and we preferred to walk round the corner to have a drink in The Feathers (which was quieter and a more relaxed atmosphere with plenty of space and nice sofas and arm chairs to just sit back and relax on, although that is obviously personal choice for us).
reviews.title: Lovely Visit

reviews.text: Parking is in a long stay car park, probably about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We paid £2.50 (for over 4 hours). Was worried about leaving the car on a public car park but no problems and I think quite a few cars are left there on a night.
reviews.title: Very good sunday lunch

reviews.text: Ledbury is a lovely town to wander around, clean and a good choice of shops and a beautiful church. Also well worth having a look around the Painted House if it is open (accessed from the alleyway leading from the main road to the Church).
reviews.title: Fantastic food and lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely recommend staying at The Talbot as it is reasonably priced with friendly helpful staff and food that is of a very high quality.
reviews.title: Good value and great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are a visitor to the UK and want to try a traditional English pint in a very traditional setting then go to the Talbot. Steeped in atmosphere, the history leaps from the walls.
reviews.title: One night stay in January

reviews.text: We spent a very Happy New year here with friends. Rooms comfortable and warm, beer, cider and wine good, food great, staff very friendly. Just be aware of low ceilings in some rooms. Tudor dining room a pleasure to eat in.
reviews.title: Happy New Year

reviews.text: Good food, good service, Excellent host. Great atmosphere. Quality crackers with a worthwhile prize and for a Christmas Day very reasonably priced. Worth the journey. We were asked if everything was ok. We had time between courses to relax and digest. There was no rush and no long waits. I would definitely go back again.
reviews.title: Christmas Day Lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small, friendly, good clean and well appointed rooms in this quirky old world inn. It was quiet, despite being in the centre of this charming market town. The food was good and reasonably priced. All around, well worth a visit!
reviews.title: Perfect town hotel

reviews.text: Traditional town pub/ restaurant and inn in the lovely market town of Ledbury in Herefordshire. Stopped here once again for lunch after a morning in Malvern as that was the way we wanted to go. The food was lovely reasonably priced and so fresh, combined with good Wadworths beer and an oak pannelled dining roomI was in heaven. Great place and a lovely town
reviews.title: Step inside and back in time

reviews.text: We visited this inn for lunch. We loved the paneeling in the dining room, the service and most of all the delicuous pie! Only one moan - why offer it with chips? No-one could possibly eat the pie and chips, and in any case the pie is far superior to anything normally served up with chips as a filler.
reviews.title: Wonderful pie for lunch

reviews.text: We live locally and wanted a meal for a special famiy occasion. We booked a table for 9 and as the time we requested was 30 mins before they stopped serving food, we were asked to order the food in advance. We also had a cake, balloons, bubbles and table confetti delivered to the pub beforehand.
reviews.title: Family occasion.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon our arrival the table had been beautifully set - this was all done without my knowledge so a lovely surprise for me! The food quickly arrived, the 3 steaks cooked as requested in 3 different ways and the food was all very tasty. We followed with desserts and cheesboard which were all beautifully presented. The waitress, Charlotte, then brought out the cake and everything else we needed.
reviews.title: Martyn & Linda

reviews.text: The bill was very resonable and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Charming and welcoming place to stay

reviews.text: I'd also like to add how very clean the toilets were too!
reviews.title: Traditional English Pub - Great!

reviews.text: Thanks Andy and staff. You all helped make a special occasion into a very lovely day.
reviews.title: Well worth a visit.
